Name: Coffee Cocktail
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Wine glass .
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Garnish with dusting of nutmeg grated over cocktail.
Review: As the 1887 edition of the Professor's book says, " The name of this drink is a misnomer, as coffee and bitters are not to be found among its ingredients, but it looks like coffee when it has been properly concocted. "
History: Adapted from a recipe in the posthumously published 1887 Jerry Thomas' Bar-tenders Guide (Jerry "The Professor" Thomas died 15th December 1885).
